description: The objective of this non-credit course is to expose students to the nature and scope of Arts and Business and prepare them in selecting their major.
title: Introduction to Arts and Business
subject: ARBUS

description: The functional areas of business: finance, personnel administration, production, marketing, and accounting are examined within differing organizational structures. Coverage also includes study of the principles of effective management and the financial system as a source of corporate capital.
title: Introduction to Business in North America
prerequisites: Arts and Business Co-op and Regular students.
subject: ARBUS

description: This course is designed for non-accountants who will use accounting information for planning, control and decision making.
title: Accounting Information for Managers
subject: ARBUS

corequisites: ECON 101 (for Global Business & Digital Arts students).
description: The role of the entrepreneur, the entrepreneurial firm, and the creative society are examined. Students are exposed to the practices that enable workplace creativity and innovation with exposure to leadership theory and project management.
title: Entrepreneurship Principles and Practices
prerequisites: ECON 101; Level at least 2A Honours Arts & Business, Management Studies.
antirequisites: ECON 220/ARBUS 201, ARBUS 200 taken prior to Fall 2013
subject: ARBUS

description: The role of entrepreneurship in the economy, especially with respect to competition, innovation and investment; historical experience, theoretical framework, market dynamics, public policy and practical applications.
title: The Principles of Entrepreneurship
prerequisites: ECON 101; Level at least 2A Honours Arts and Business
subject: ARBUS

description: Study of ethical and moral issues that typically arise in professional and business activity. What responsibilities to society at large do people in such business and professional activities as teaching, engineering, planning, architecture, and accounting have? How far should professional autonomy extend?
title: Professional and Business Ethics
prerequisites: Level at least 2A Honours Arts and Business students
subject: ARBUS

description: This course examines leadership, team dynamics, and communication in organizational contexts. Students will develop communication knowledge and skills to enhance their abilities to be effective in leadership and team roles.
title: Leadership, Teams, and Communication
prerequisites: Level at least 2A Arts and Business students.
subject: ARBUS

description: This course will introduce students to important and relevant business skills that will assist them as they prepare for successful careers. The course will supplement contemporary theories with appropriate case studies.
title: Practical Business Skills
subject: ARBUS

description: This course examines the opportunities, risks, and challenges faced by businesses in international markets, as well as the preparation required to operate them.
title: International Business
prerequisites: ARBUS 101; Level at least 3A Arts and Business students
subject: ARBUS

description: Economic principles for marketing, exchange theory and consumer analysis, product or service introductions, public and private policies for advertising, differentiation, and quality assurance.
title: Marketing: Principles of Marketing and Consumer Economics
subject: ARBUS

description: A capstone course designed to integrate the arts and business components of the program that incorporate the principles of strategy for the purpose of enabling students to effectively position themselves for opportunities after graduation.
title: Strategy and Program Integration
subject: ARBUS
